content.h2: Advanced Therapeutic Techniques for Stubborn Muscle Problems
content.h3_1: What to Expect During Your Deep Tissue Massage
content.h4: The Deep Tissue Approach at Amika
content.paragraph1: Deep tissue massage is a specialised therapeutic technique designed to address chronic pain, persistent muscle tension, and deep-seated restrictions that haven't responded to lighter massage approaches. Unlike relaxation massage that works on surface muscles, deep tissue therapy uses slower, more deliberate strokes with focused pressure to access the deeper layers of muscle tissue and fascia—the connective tissue surrounding muscles. This intensive approach is particularly effective for chronic lower back pain, frozen shoulder, sports injuries, repetitive strain problems, and long-standing muscular issues.
content.paragraph2: Professionally certified in deep tissue techniques since January 2024, I understand how to apply therapeutic pressure safely and effectively—working with your body's tolerance whilst achieving genuine clinical results. This isn't about causing pain; it's about accessing deeper muscle layers to break down adhesions, release chronic holding patterns, and restore proper function. Many clients worry deep tissue will be unbearable, but when performed correctly by a qualified therapist, it should feel intense but relieving—productive discomfort, not damage. Communication is essential throughout the session, and I'll adjust pressure based on your feedback to ensure the treatment is both effective and manageable.
content.orderedList1: Comprehensive assessment of your problem areas, pain patterns, movement restrictions, and how long you've been experiencing issues to understand the root cause
content.orderedList2: Targeted deep pressure techniques applied to affected muscles and connective tissue, systematically working through adhesions and trigger points whilst monitoring your tolerance
content.orderedList3: Post-treatment guidance including stretching recommendations, self-care practices, and advice on managing any temporary soreness, plus a follow-up treatment plan if needed
content.h4_2: Therapeutic Benefits of Deep Tissue Massage
content.unorderedList1: Breaks up scar tissue and adhesions from old injuries or repetitive strain, restoring normal tissue function and reducing pain
content.unorderedList2: Relieves chronic muscle pain, persistent stiffness, and deep-seated tension that lighter massage hasn't resolved
content.unorderedList3: Addresses sports injuries, overuse problems, and muscular imbalances through targeted therapeutic work on affected areas
content.unorderedList4: Improves posture and movement patterns by releasing compensatory tension and restoring proper muscle function
content.unorderedList5: Increases blood flow to restricted areas, promoting healing and reducing inflammation in chronically tight tissues
content.unorderedList6: Provides lasting relief rather than temporary comfort—addressing underlying problems, not just symptoms
